name: ANA Crowne Plaza Osaka

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will make this quick and honest.
reviews.title: SOOO AMAZING!!!

reviews.text: From the second you arrive, throughout your entire stay and when you leave.... you will be a happier person.
reviews.title: Excellent Value
best!
reviews.text: Nothing compares to the staff and how they took care of us. The concierge (female) I forgot her name but she was sooo kind. she took her time with helping me get to the castle. she even lent me an experimental translator machine to take with me.

the rooms were huge for Japanese standards. they also look very recently renovated. Impressive and large flat panel TV. Comfy beds! Very cool control panel next to your bed to control the lights and even to activate the do not disturb sign outside your door.
reviews.title: High quality hotel in a great location

reviews.text: Staff can speak English. did not get to try the facilities such as the restaurant but it looked awesome!
reviews.title: Beautiful city view; not great business facilities

reviews.text: We used the Crownw Plaza for our annaul employee meeting. the rooms were very nice, service was great and we were impressed with the banquet services. Overall they did a nice job.
reviews.title: They did a great job.

reviews.text: Stayed here for 7 nights in a standard twin room with teenage daughter. Like all aspects of Japan service is superb. I booked through Priority Club on internet. Does not get it for you any cheaper but you accumulate points. Internet booking direct is best for a good rate.Staff in all areas of Hotel are wonderful, can not put a foot wrong Great pool & relaxation room.Breakfast buffet is lovely with good selection of food to suit all tastes.Easy 10 minute walk to Osaka Station, lots of dept stores & shops around the station. Also heaps of great budget eating places around the hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing service.

reviews.text: The hotel staff are very helpful, and gave us 2 connecting rooms. The rooms are spacious enough for Japan's standards and we are very pleased with them. The guest relation officer is very helpful and can speak English. In fact, there are often a few staff at the lobby looking out for any needs of the guests.
reviews.title: Good enough

reviews.text: Location is not as convenient as other hotels and it's about 10-15 minutes via taxi to ShinOsaka train station. There's a cafe nearby if one doesn't want to take the hotel breakfast.
reviews.title: Worst Crowne Plaza ever

reviews.text: Description on website about room is totally inaccurate. I booked a double bed club room and it was very small. Room size and bed size were not given at all under room description when I booked. Inclusions in the room were also different. Seems like ANA and IHG operate independently. Anyone who wishes to book a room in this hotel should email them and clarify type of room first.
reviews.title: We want to go back!!!!!

reviews.text: We also stayed at the Hilton also during this trip & there is no aspect (except the free pool) I could rate at this Hotel over the Hilton. Upon checking in we couldn't get either of, non smoking, connecting or even adjacent rooms even though we had requested & had 3 young kids. The bearkfast was OK although inferior to the Hilton,.I only got around 2 hours sleep due to some motor noise initially I thought it was our or next door's bathroom fan but in the morning I discovered it was the mini bar compressor, in the morning it was the noise of next door guest talking I couldn't complain to them as it was clear they were not talking loudly but the walls were too thin. Even the free pool is small & old , initially we were told it was full & we would have to wait perhaps 1 hour when I insisted on entering there was only 7 swimmers but the pool was so small they considered it full. This hotel is at least 20 mins walk from the airport bus/train & the immediate area appeared to cater to business men looking for a drink & some female company(Japanese style). If available at a similar price stay at the hilton.
reviews.title: cannot recommend

reviews.text: Hotel is located in down town Osaka nearby shopping centers, Universal studios, and Aquarium. Accessible by subway about 5 minutes of walk to nearest station. There are many restaurants just steps away from the property for variety of japanese food.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with great service in central location.
Good Hotel
reviews.text: Club floor room were very comfortable and spacious with a nice city view and we all enjoyed the breakfast and happy hour at club lounge. Staff are english speaking and very helpful in assisting us getting to places and provided great suggestions for my family to do while we were there for 3 days.
I would recommend this hotel to a friend and definitely return to stay.
reviews.title: fabulous

reviews.text: I stayed in the ANA Crowne Plaza for three days. It is centrally located in walking distance to the Umeda station.
reviews.title: Good location, reasonable rates and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very good stay in a hotel with probably the biggest room out of the five Japan hotels I have visited.
reviews.title: Nice stay, big room, very comfortable.

reviews.text: Great staff and a very comfortable bed and pillow.
reviews.title: Simple Modern Clean hotel for sofisticated ladies and gentlemen

reviews.text: Resoanbly easy to get to from the train station, with a quick Taxi trip if you prefer not to walk.
reviews.title: Cozy Place in the center of Osaka

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No complaints regarding the hoetl and plenty to do in Osaka.
reviews.title: Fell short of expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is reccently renovated and unified colors with dark chic brown. Very wide and modern lobby, good Chinese restaurant, and quiet club lounge. The room (we stayed Club Floor) was very clean, especially the bath room was big and comfortable. Had a choise of pillows, ordered aroma oil for a good sleep. The amenity goods for a good sleep is well prepared.
reviews.title: First class hotel, amazing service

description: ANA HOTEL OSAKA made a brand new start as ANA CROWNE PLAZA OSAKA on 1st October 2008.ANA Crowne Plaza Osaka is located in the central of Osaka, known as a city of water, and is overlooking Dojima river. Very convenient for visiting both on business and entertainment purposes. Yodoyabashi is one of the leading streets for office buildings and Kitashinshi is one of the best places for socializing. Our location is indeed a great base for discovering and exploring Kobe, Nara and other Kansai regions.With our utmost confidence, our luxurious and specious guest rooms consist of four categories: Suite rooms on 24th floor, Club rooms on 22nd and 23rd floors, Upper rooms from 19th throughout 21st floors, and Regular rooms from 7th throughout 18th floors. All guest rooms are based on quality bed linen, luxury duvet sets and complimentary high speed internet access. Newly appointed executive Club Floors in summer 2008, all club rooms are accessed with room card keys for upgraded security. Breakfast, afternoon tea, and cocktail time could be spend exclusively at Club Lounge during a stay along with a privilege as business support.
